product_specification.Covered in Warranty: Warranty is Non-transferrable, Valid Only in the Territory of India and Extended Only to the First End User Customer (Customer). Warranty will be Valid Only When the Original Purchase Invoice is Presented at the Time of Service. Warranty will Cover Only Functional Parts and Software Issues Having Manufacturing Defects and Does Not Cover Damages Resulting From Un-authorised Adaptations / Adjustments / Tampering of the Product, Improper Installation of the Product, Normal Wear and Tear Caused Due to Use of Product
product_specification.Not Covered in Warranty: Warranty Does Not Cover Damage Caused to the Product Due to Improper Installation by Customer, Normal Wear and Tear Caused Due to Use of Product. Warranty Does Not Cover Any External Accessories to the Product (Such as Battery, Cable, Carrying Bag Etc). All Plastic, Rubber, Glass, or Aesthetic Parts and Consumable Replacements will be on a Chargeable Basis. All Transportation and Handling Expenses Incurred While Replacing or Repairing Will be Payable by the Customer. Warranty Shall be Voids If: a) The Type or Serial No. On the Product has been Altered, Removed or Defaced. The Product is not Operated as Per the Instructions Given in the User Guide, If Any
product_specification.Installation & Demo Details:
Please note that any unauthorized handling or self-installation of the product will lead to return & product warranty being void
We'll facilitate the installation and demo through authorized service engineer at your convenience. Flipkart will communicate the day and time slot of the scheduled Installation & Demo through a SMS and the same information will also be available in your order details page. The service engineer will install your new TV, either on wall mount or on table top. Installation and demo are provided free of cost. The engineer will also help you understand your new TV's features. The process generally covers: Wall-mounted or table-top installation, as requested. Physical check of all ports, including power and USB ports. Accessories also checked. Demonstration of features and settings. Quick run-through on how to operate the TV

product_description.4K HDR Ultra HD Resolution: Thanks to this TV's 3840 x 2160 resolution, it effectively displays 16.7 million colors, which means you can watch every scene with a picture-perfect clarity. That's not all, the HDR brings to life all the shades of blue with ultra clarity.
product_description.Dolby Digital Sound with Surround Sound: To provide you with a theatre-like experience at home with an immersive and multi-dimensional sound, this TV comes with Dolby Digital Sound with Surround Sound.

review: What a amazing tv of all it is an best tv from all i loved so i buy two tv together ✌️???

After a long research I dotted on this TV.... And I'm not disappointed, the looks of the tv are superb with clean and fine finishing, giving the 43" size I'm surprised with the picture quality, the panel is a+ grade one, the sound is great, I have a tatasky hd connection and HD channels are a treat to watch, the quality we get at this budget is simply amazing, though it takes a lil time to get connected to YouTube, we r enjoying bufferless streaming once it starts as I have a 15 Mbps broadband connection, I would have given 5 if it was given a 1gb ram and storage rom... Finally I'm satisfied with this smart tv. In one line "SMART BUY"👍

Writing review after few weeks of usage. TV has amazing picture quality and sound. HDR format settings are not available in picture settings, but it is automatically switching to HDR format (HDR day / HDR night / HDR dynamic) when I play 4K HDR / 4K Dolby vision supported movies from Netflix / i tunes, and it is supporting HDR 10 format upto 50 Hz. If you love watching movies, then go for it. I personally feel I am getting more than what I paid for, and MARQ may increase the price once this item becomes more popular.
Cons, I noticed a small black bar, in some 4K scenes, horizontally while fiddling with some settings, but it disappeared when I turned TV off and on. Hopefully it was a temporary problem.

One 🌟 for installation process and costomer care services also after sales service . After 10 days I installed local service.... and expend Rs. 500 extra and dismissed my return policy... but I am good luck .... tv is good condition.....
But TV is best for this price range.
Picture quality is nice. Sound is good....
I request to Flipkart please improve your service for rural areas..... increase Jeeves Service area.....

Faster delivery and installation happened with in 24 hours of delivery.
Very knowledgeable technician who is very polite and shows his competency during demo.
I have taken 2 years extended warranty at very low price.
Active follow up from service support team.
Quite amazing performance even at low volume level.
Dolby sound effect is really good.
Value for money

Lenovo k8 plus not supported for screen cast. amazon prime also not working. but in this price range quality of picture sound and other smart features are good. if it's durable then it's excellent in this price range and quality. after few days of usage I will rewrite my review.

Value for Money for sure. you won't get a product packed with so many features at 10K mark. Picture quality is superb. Sound is loud enough for a 150SqFt room. Super quick delivery and installation by Flipkart and Jeeves respectively - within 24 hours of order placement.

Few issues with connectiviity though. Here are few cons that I have been encountering after a week's usage.
1. WiFi connection takes time. couple times it took more than 3 minutes for the TV to get connected to WiFi. I checked and it wasn't an issue with my router.
2. You can't download softwares on the TV. This is not an android TV. There are other versions of MarQ that are full Smart TVs.
3. No way to cast your phone. the built-in software (Aircast Live) is no more available for download on your phone as the company is no more in business.

Overall I am satisfied with the performance. Netflix and YouTube work exceptionally well. haven't tried connecting external devices through HDMI or USB.

Final Verdict - If you are going to view DTH / Cable programs on the TV primarily with minimal usage of SMART features, go for it without a doubt.

pros:
-Mind blowing picture quality. being a VA panel, it has deep blacks making watching movies a great experience. Play the right 4k video on YouTube or Netflix and you'll be transported into the scene by the colors and details. it's a smart TV not Android TV but I didn't go for the Android TV as it has IPS panel which is good for gaming but doesn't give the best blacks.
- Excellent sound. Different modes of sound available like speech, night, theater which really have an impact.
- HDR looks great on Netflix

cons:
- no audio search in remote
- connectivity issue in Netflix. whenever TV wakes up from sleep, Netflix doesn't always work even though internet shows connected. requires tv to be powered off and turned on again.
- limited apps

This is a tv meant for watching good content and in that front, it's the best out there no doubt. but it does lack features which make life easier. using the remote to search is a pain. and some bugs present in apps. a firestick should solve all these problems if needed. if lots of apps and ease of use is a priority, go for the Android version of the same tv but you will be sacrificing picture quality as it's a IPS panel.

overall, a 4k tv for less than 35k , I can't help but give it a full 5 stars.

Good TV for the pricing. There are some screenbleeding/light glow issues when the viewing angle goes more than the recommended one. For that you have to adjust the contrast and brightness.

It's only a smart tv and not a Android TV (just to include it here) you don't get playstore, you cannot sideload apps. Justifies the price though.

You can watch YouTube and NetFlix, but you cannot watch PrimeVideos and not even Hotstar as that isn't supported even by the browser it has.

App store has limited apps which aren't useful in our daily life usage.

What is the use of this, For this price range, you get a good big screen with good in-built speakers which is quite loud and clear.

You can connect this TV through WiFi, Ethernet, and also with your wireless mouse or keyboard (only which has Wi-Fi adapter).

The panel as per my knowledge, It looks like a VA panel to me. Though only A+ panel has been mentioned, so I can't really tell.

But, VA panel is what I think it is.
The colors are good, Blacks are also good.
And if you watch it with proper viewing angle (right in-front of the TV) then you can experience deep blacks as if you are using a big sized smartphone with Super AMOLED display. When we move to a bit off side then we can see the blacks decreasing and slowly starting to appear dark grey and medium grey (at more extended side view).

Colors also fade from side view because of low viewing angle.
It's not a IPS panel, So it is understandable.

Good for houses which has 4-5 people's who can site in front the TV on a sofa.

Tip: Keep this TV in the center wall of your hall or bedroom to actually enjoy the richness of this TV.

Picture - Sacrifice viewing angles for contrast. VA panel gives you better Black reproduction than IPS panels. Do not tap on the screen while the TV is on. It causes white flashes. Not sure if that would damage the LED's in any way. So avoid doing that.

Sound - I've got my TV hooked up to a Yamaha Home Theatre. The TV's stand alone 20 Watt speakers are good when i switch to Netflix or YouTube. However, I cant seem to get the home theatre to work when Netflix or YouTube is on.

Navigation - Its a pain typing something in the search bar when using Netflix or YouTube.
Linux OS is pretty smooth and crisp. Somehow, I am yet to figure out how the Tv is able to control my Yamaha Home theatre. I just turn on the Tv and it turns on my home theatre intuitively. If its a planned feature by Marq then its pretty damn smart i must say !!!
Dedicated buttons for Netflix and YouTube on the remote is quite handy.

Build Quality - Don't need anything better than what's offered my Marq. Its worth every penny.

Delivery by Flipkart - As usual - Before time. Delivery guys ensured that my tv wasnt damaged in transit. A thorough check was done and feedback taken immediately on delivery site.
Installation - A day before the scheduled date. It would have been installed on the same day if the engineer hadn't been held up with another client. That's completely understandable. The engineer took a while to figure out the wall mount mechanism. But with a little brainstorming, we managed to get it done. (The wall mount has to be off-center by 2 inches for this tv.)
Overall experience 10 days since - Pleased to the point that I would recommend the brand - both Marq and Flipkart.

Cheers!

Here are my initial impressions of my recent purchase of Flipkart Marq 55 inches TV.
I was not in market for a new TV. I have an 40 inch AOC TV which has served me faithfully and has excellent picture quality.
However, while surfing Flipkart site during recent sale, I came across this TV and was interested. Additional 2 years warranty sealed the deal.
I chose this non-android TV as Official Android TV is still work in development & doesn’t support many apps yet.
This TV supports a VEWD App store, which provides few HTML5 based apps including Netflix and youtube. When paired with good Android TV box with minimum 2gb ram, there are hundreds of apps available to install. Android TV box is able to install all of them, unlike android TV. I use Tanix 3X Mini with 2GB RAM and it is able to run more than 70 apps. It comes with inbuilt kodi app and there are lots of apps on aptoide TV store, which provide contents for free.
Another advantage is VA panel, which provides a good contrast. Also I had seen OLED panels go haywire due to thermal runaway, thus needing whole panel to be replaced.
Now about Flipkart. The earlier TV was damaged during transit. However, with timely follow up by Flipkart and Jeeves installation team, replacement was done quickly.
TV was finally installed yesterday and I am happy with experience. Viewing angles are very good despite poor reviews about VA panels. Contrast is very good and viewing is pleasing to eyes.
This TV needs a good set top box as sd channels are not sharp.
Sound is loud and clear. I am unable to connect my home theatre as audio output socket is of S/PIDF type and headphone jack is missing.
I will update review after few days.

I bought this tv because many of my friends recommended the brand and i was happy with 43inch marq android tv. I bought this expecting similar quality but the display on this is pathetic. The 4k upscaler which they mentioned is of no use. If i play 4k content it looks good/ok. If i play any content in even 1080p it looks very bad and skintones are very white and not at all natural. The HDR doesn't work at all. Imagine playing 720p content like your HD channels from dish tv, they look very very poor and you can't recognize faces. If it's not HD channel then its better you don't take a dish connection. Very poor display quality. Blacks are gray and not black. The contrast ratio is very very terrible. Trust me guys i can adjust for a average display quality but this is pathetic. It looks very gray and if you set dynamic contrast its uneven and changes abruptly. It makes faces very bad. Even with little increase in contrast makes it look bad. There's no way to return this and i regret that. this is not a smart TV. it is a wanna be tv with a mask of a smart TV. this is good for people who want to save money and watch content exclusively with set top box which is an archaic and redundant way of watching stuff.

Cons:
1) it's not an Android TV. so no apps are supported. Hence forget about Jioapp, hotstar, sonyliv, curiosity stream or any apps. you will get bunch of default apps and that's it.
2) You open the browser and try to see the content on the website, good luck. the system memory is so low that the browser crashes. if it doesn't crash in sharp 5 minutes then it will freeze there for eternity.
3) Screen mirroring is supported only on certain handsets. and this shouldn't come as surprise to Flipkart or service partner (Jeeves) . in fact it is their default answer. You might ask: " hey if they know that all devices are not supported, then why are they not communicating it". well you better ask them because customer experience is a thing of the past. all they need is your money. have tried Moto, Lenovo and Yu yureka. didn't work. worked on one of the 2 technician's phone. hurray!!

4) Overall OS is lagging

5) no return policy. only replacement is entertained. no upgrades either. so if you buy it you are stuck with it.

Pros:
1) good image and lag free for set top box
2) good sound quality

Conclusion:
if you are lured by the price and the tag of smart TV, then pls don't buy this dumb tv. rather buy Marq normal tv if price is the criteria. And buy an HDMI or Chromecast in future.

if you want a genuine smart TV which supports apps blindly buy MI Tv.
and visit their experience center and buy it from there. they are honest and upfront about everything and not sneaky

won't recommend this or Flipkart to any genuine buyer.

So, If I am ready to overlook my struggle to find the ideal picture settings without getting saturated washouts for fine gradient colours on rich pictures, the other things are nice about this TV. Sound is excellent; The built-in APPs work very well (including NetFlix at 4K). The WiFi and Ethernet is solid. The boot-up is super quick and it switches into the HDMI one very quickly, as it boots the OS in the background...

After watching 10 days I have given the review of thisMarq 32inch LED TV.

1.At first picture quality is too good in this price range.1080p, 4k videos runs very smoothly and gives crystal quality picture.But if you are using Local cable then check their frequency.Please put HD channels if you are using Local Cable Connection and you can see far better images.I have no TATA SKY or DISH TV.So I don't know what quality of images they provide in SD channels.

2.Now come to the Sound point.It gives you tremendous volume in just 5 when you using Youtube or any other USB.Sound quality is best.But you have to put more sound if you are using Local Cable in AV mode.

3.At Last the Connectivity.It just an average when you using your internet connection for Youtube or Netflix.I think it's bit slow and most of the time faces the connectivity problem.That time you have to power off the tv and again on it.

Overall in this price range I think Flipkart Marq is a good option for buying.But if anyone wants to use only smart tv with internet then I think it's not worth for you.Its better for those who use Cable or DTH and also sometimes use internet.

Flipkart is selling 2 types of 55 inch 4K TV, one for 35k and the other for 39K. I wanted to buy the one with IPS panel which has Android 8 software. The features that you get for the extra 4-5k is worth it. Also I too the extended warranty for this model which was for Rs 2999. Mysteriously for the 55K IPS model the extended warranty is for Rs 999. Unfortunately I inadvertently ordered the inferior one and according to Flipkart the only provide a replacement, not return. The picture clarity is however very good, so is the sound. The apps are very limited (YouTube and Netflix are the only face savers). HD channels have great clarity however you will be unhappy with the ordinary ones. Since I happen to purchase during the Diwali period the product got delivered in a lethargic 2 weeks time. Also I had to place repeated complaints with Flipkart to get the installation done ASAP as it had crossed 3 days after delivery period. If you purely want to watch HD channels and no app gimmicks then you can quietly go ahead, I would however fully recommend for the IPS version. 3 stars dor picture, sound and connectivity.
